intro: Ornithogalum quartinianum, commonly known as the silverleaf star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spherical berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Ornithogalum quartinianum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
